title: Róger Gómez
text:
Róger Gómez Tenorio (born February 7, 1965) is a retired <a href="Costa%20Rica">Costa Rica</a>n <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Club career.
Born in <a href="Palmar%20Sur">Palmar Sur</a>, Gómez played for Municipal Osa, <a href="C.S.%20Cartagin%C3%A9s">Cartaginés</a> and <a href="C.S.%20Herediano">Herediano</a> and scored 119 league goals during his career, 38 of them for Herediano. He was dismissed by Herediano in November 1995 after a poor season.
He played a total of 524 matches in the Costa Rican Primera División from 1986 through 2002.
International career.
Nicknamed "El Policía", he made his debut for <a href="Costa%20Rica%20national%20football%20team">Costa Rica</a> in a May 1990 <a href="friendly%20match">friendly match</a> against <a href="Poland%20national%20football%20team">Poland</a> and earned a total of 19 caps, scoring 4 goals. He was part of the national team squad, that played in the <a href="1990%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1990 FIFA World Cup</a> held in Italy, and featured in three of their four games played. He scored the first goal in the <a href="UNCAF%20Nations%20Cup">UNCAF Nations Cup</a> history in 1991, and also played at the <a href="1991%20CONCACAF%20Gold%20Cup">1991 CONCACAF Gold Cup</a>.
He played his final international on 8 November 1992 against <a href="Honduras%20national%20football%20team">Honduras</a>.
Managerial career.
After retiring as a player, Gómez became a manager and was in charge of several local sides like Osa as well as of Panamanian side <a href="Atl%C3%A9tico%20Verag%C3%BCense">Atlético Veragüense</a>.
